Kim Yong Nam Meets American 
    Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, had a talk with Selig Harrison, senior fellow of the U.S. "Woodrow Wilson Center", at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.
 Present on the occasion was Kim Kye Gwan, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.

articles.content:
New Novels Off Press in DPRK
    Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The Literature and Arts Publishing House of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has published full-length novels "Sunlight over the Cloud", "Undying Flame" and "Rainbow", which are based on the struggle of unconverted long-term prisoners Kim U Thaek, Jo Chang Son and Son Song Mo respectively.
 They had been kept in prison in south Korea for 40, 30 and 19 years for they fought for the reunification of the country. They, however, remained true to the oath they made for the country and the nation, in the teeth of ghastly torture and appeasement by fascists.    
 The novels show that with absolute trust in their leader and Party and a strong sense of obligation for them and with revolutionary faith, the heroes could become indomitable men strong in ideology and will.

Subcommittees of North Preparatory Committee Formed
    Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Subcommittees were formed at the second plenary meeting of the North Preparatory Committee for joint functions of Koreans in the north and the south and overseas to implement the June 15 joint declaration held in Pyongyang Thursday.
 The meeting discussed the formation of subcommittees to suit the growing enthusiasm of supporting and implementing the June 15 joint declaration and brisk preparatory work for June 15 pro-reunification functions at home and abroad.    
 It decided to establish subcommittees of workers, agricultural workers, youth and students, women, teaching staff, academy, literature and art, sports, public health, environment, media and religion under the North Preparatory Committee and elected chairpersons, vice-chairpersons and members of those subcommittees.
